<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/29/elon-musk-gives-secondever-presentation-demonstrating-neuralinks-brain-implant?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Open a Tesla With Your Brain
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Neuralink slide" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjUzL25ldXJhbGlua19zbGlkZS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Screenshot from presentation</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Elon Musk continued his assault on the impossible last night, delivering a <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/28/21406143/elon-musk-neuralink-ai-pigs-demo-brain-computer-interface?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rare update</a> on the status of Neuralink, his neuroscience company with the long-term goal of facilitating symbiosis between humans and AI. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Wait, Elon has a neuroscience company?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Of course he does. Musk founded Neuralink four years ago, distilling the company's vision in a <a href="https://waitbutwhy.com/2017/04/neuralink.html#part4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">2017 blog post</a>: “We are aiming to bring something to market that helps with certain severe brain injuries (stroke, cancer lesion, congenital) in about four years.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The device it's developing utilizes tiny “threads,” about a third of the size of thin human hair, that are stitched into the brain by a “sewing machine-like” robot. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In the picture above, you can see what Neuralink has been up to the last year, reducing the length of the threads to just a few centimeters. Elon </span><span><a href="https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/gadgets-and-tech/news/neuralink-elon-musk-event-watch-online-live-updates-a9694996.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">described it last</a></span><span> night as a “Fitbit in your skull with tiny wires.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">As is usually the case with Elon,</strong> it’s not as far fetched as it sounds. Matt Nagle, a person with spinal cord paralysis, received a brain implant in 2006 that allowed him to <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/7/16/20697123/elon-musk-neuralink-brain-reading-thread-robot?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">play Pong</a> using just his mind. Since then, researchers have continued to explore ways computers could improve brain function. “Neuralink didn’t come out of nowhere, there’s a long history of academic research here,” Neuralink president Max Hodak said in 2019. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like last year's event, Elon emphasized that the purpose of this presentation was to <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/08/28/elon-musk-demonstrates-neuralinks-tech-live-using-pigs-with-surgically-implanted-brain-monitoring-devices/#:~:text=TechCrunch-,Elon%20Musk%20demonstrates%20Neuralink's%20tech%20live%20using,surgically%2Dimplanted%20brain%20monitoring%20devices&text=Elon%20Musk%20%2Dfounded%20Neuralink%20has,human%20brain%20and%20computing%20devices.?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recruit people</a> to work at Neuralink (no neuroscience experience required). But that didn’t stop him from speculating on what the device could eventually achieve. Musk touched on everything from quadriplegics playing video games to opening a Tesla with your mind (he said there’s a 100% chance this happens). But the first uses are still <a href="https://www.cnet.com/news/elon-musks-neuralink-its-like-a-fitbit-in-your-skull/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">medical in nature</a>. "I'm confident in the long term it'll be possible to restore somebody's full body motion," he said. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Some analysts expected a human trial last night, but got pig demonstrations instead. People's brains are on the horizon, though—Musk announced that the FDA granted Neuralink "breakthrough device" designation, allowing the company to proceed on an accelerated timeline toward human trials.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/28/sp-500-best-august-decades?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Shhhhhhhh—Don’t Tell Stocks There’s a Pandemic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Stock market doge meme with one big doge and one small doge" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjUyL3N0b2NrX21hcmtldF9kb2dlX21lbWUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Toby Howell</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The S&P 500 had its best August since 1986, even while we had our worst August since DC's <em>Suicide Squad </em>came out. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What happened?</strong> Big Tech happened. The de facto rulers of our world—Apple, Amazon, Facebook, Google, and Microsoft—account for almost a quarter of the S&P 500. And their share prices have skyrocketed (especially Apple) this summer while the pandemic pushed our lives further into the digital realm. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Let this sink in: </strong>The market capitalization of U.S. tech stocks is <a href="https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/us-tech-stocks-worth-more-european-stock-market-apple-microsoft-2020-8-1029545001?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">now greater</a> than the value of the entire European stock market, according to Bank of America. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On Thursday, tech stocks hit $9.1 trillion in value; European stocks are worth $8.9 trillion. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Life does exist outside of tech, though, and “reopening” stocks like Delta and cruise lines also jumped this month. The Dow, not known for its tech prowess, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/27/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">erased its losses</a> for the year yesterday.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>The economy was humming before the pandemic hit. Investors are betting that, with the Fed’s emergency measures and a vaccine in the works, we’ll eventually pick up where we left off. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/28/nba-playoffs-return-multi-day-strike-organized-players?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The NBA Returns
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="NBA players kneeling" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjUwL25iYV9wbGF5ZXJzX2tuZWVsaW5nLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mike Ehrmann/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The NBA playoffs <a href="https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2906646-nba-postpones-friday-playoff-games-to-protest-racism-resuming-saturday?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will resume this afternoon</a> after the players association and the league came to an agreement on issues concerning social justice and racial inequality yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> The Milwaukee Bucks decided not to play in their playoff game on Wednesday to protest the police shooting of Jacob Blake, a Black man, in Kenosha, WI. Many teams in other sports leagues <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/27/nba-players-strike-racial-justice?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">joined in</a>, culminating in a historic week of athlete activism.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The nowstory: </strong>In a <a href="https://twitter.com/TimBontemps/status/1299386010489499652?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1299386010489499652&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fbleacherreport.com%2Farticles%2F2906646-nba-postpones-friday-playoff-games-to-protest-racism-resuming-saturday&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">joint statement</a>, the league and the players outlined three main initiatives:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Establish a social justice coalition made up of players, coaches, and team officials </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Work with local governments to convert NBA arenas into safe voting locations for the 2020 election </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Reserve ad spots during each playoff game to promote voter participation and education</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>NBA players stopped the playoffs because they thought basketball was distracting the country from focusing on larger issues. With concrete reforms in hand, they're betting that resuming play will allow them to keep social justice issues top of mind as we head into the election.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
LOGISTICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/28/race-build-cold-storage-facilities-covid-vaccine?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What Do Chunky Monkey and a COVID Vaccine Have in Common?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Elmo shivering in snow" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=457 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/KFUx0Rtz7p0HTzbJ7x/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Elmo shivering in snow" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/KFUx0Rtz7p0HTzbJ7x/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They don’t work without a freezer.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>As coronavirus vaccines enter late-stage clinical trials, logistics providers are <a href="https://www.fiercepharma.com/manufacturing/pfizer-moderna-s-covid-19-shot-rollouts-could-be-ice-as-analysts-question-cold?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">scrambling</a> to build supply chains that effectively transport those vaccines, once they’re ready, from manufacturing facilities to your doctor’s office.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But these vaccines are the worst kind of passenger—they <em>need</em> to be kept at very specific (and very cold) temperatures along their route, plus they’re always FaceTiming with someone. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">One example: </strong></span><span>The vaccine being developed by Pfizer and BioNTech needs to be stored at -94° Fahrenheit. At standard refrigerated temps it would go bad in 24 hours (Pfizer claims it’s two days).</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This demand for cold storage has led to the Great Freezer Building Project of 2020, with companies like UPS and Lufthansa spawning huge “<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/from-freezer-farms-to-jets-logistics-operators-prepare-for-a-covid-19-vaccine-11598639012?mod=hp_lista_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">freezer farms</a>” near airports so they can store vaccines properly, the WSJ reports.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Even before the pandemic, cold storage was booming along with the growing needs of the pharmaceutical industry. Now, it has a higher calling.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PEOPLE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/28/warren-buffett-turns-90-sunday?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How Is Warren Buffett Spending His Last Day of 89?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Warren Buffett" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjQ5L3dhcnJlbl9idWZmZXR0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Scott Olson/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since clubbing is out of the picture...maybe a game of bridge? To celebrate the Oracle of Omaha’s 90th birthday tomorrow, we're running down a few of Buffett's greatest hits over the years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1942: </strong>At the age of 11, Buffett purchases his first stock: three shares of Cities Service preferred. Trust us, it was a lot harder without Robinhood. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1956: </strong>Instead of having a quarter-life crisis, the then-25-year-old forms a partnership with seven investors, putting down $100 of his own money.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1959: </strong>Buffett pens his <a href="https://rbcpa.com/warren-e-buffett/buffett-letters-1959-present/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first letter to partners</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1983: </strong>A single share of Berkshire Hathaway stock passes $1,000.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1991: </strong>Warren Buffett, then 60, meets Bill Gates, then 35. Much later, Buffett partners with the Gates Foundation to give away most of his wealth.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2006:</strong> A single share of Berkshire Hathaway stock hits $100,000.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2018:</strong> On cryptocurrency, Buffett <a href="https://buffett.cnbc.com/buffett-timeline/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warns</a>, “Generally, I can say with almost certainty that they will come to a bad ending.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2020:</strong> In his annual letter to shareholders, Buffett says, “Berkshire shareholders need not worry: Your company is 100% prepared for our departure.” Berkshire executives Ajit Jain and Greg Abel are <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/02/23/buffetts-annual-shareholder-letter-reveals-frustrations?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most likely</a> to succeed him.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Festival season:</strong> It was weird this year. Check out <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/08/28/travel/summer-festivals-coronavirus.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">some pictures</a> from in-person festivals, then jam out to <a href="https://www.sfoutsidelands.com/insidelands/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Outside Lands</a>'s virtual festival (called Inside Lands) this weekend.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Don't forget:</strong> <em>Business Casual </em>host Kinsey Grant's first column drops Sunday night. <a href="https://column.businesscasual.fm/signup?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Make sure you get the first edition</a>.</p>

Martin Luther King Jr.'s \"I Have A Dream\" speech.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eU.S. consumer spending \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/f7b500589ae4cbbc44d6e977971d0ba5?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased 1.9%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in July, the third straight month it’s rebounded. Analysts say new relief measures are needed from Congress to keep Americans doing what they do Brain\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Neuralink slide\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yMjUzL25ldXJhbGlua19zbGlkZS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eScreenshot from presentation\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eElon Musk continued his assault on the impossible last night, delivering a \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/28/21406143/elon-musk-neuralink-ai-pigs-demo-brain-computer-interface?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erare update\u003c/a\u003e on the status of Neuralink, his neuroscience company with the long-term goal of facilitating symbiosis between humans and AI. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWait, Elon has a neuroscience company?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOf course he does. Musk founded Neuralink four years ago, distilling the company's vision in a \u003ca href=\"https://waitbutwhy.com/2017/04/neuralink.html#part4?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e2017 blog post\u003c/a\u003e: “We are aiming to bring something to market that helps with certain severe brain injuries (stroke, cancer lesion, congenital) in about four years.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe device it's developing utilizes tiny “threads,” about a third of the size of thin human hair, that are stitched into the brain by a “sewing machine-like” robot. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn the picture above, you can see what Neuralink has been up to the last year, reducing the length of the threads to just a few centimeters. Elon \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/gadgets-and-tech/news/neuralink-elon-musk-event-watch-online-live-updates-a9694996.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edescribed it last\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e night as a “Fitbit in your skull with tiny wires.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAs is usually the case with Elon,\u003c/strong\u003e it’s not as far fetched as it sounds. Matt Nagle, a person with spinal cord paralysis, received a brain implant in 2006 that allowed him to \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/7/16/20697123/elon-musk-neuralink-brain-reading-thread-robot?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplay Pong\u003c/a\u003e using just his mind. Since then, researchers have continued to explore ways computers could improve brain function. “Neuralink didn’t come out of nowhere, there’s a long history of academic research here,” Neuralink president Max Hodak said in 2019. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike last year's event, Elon emphasized that the purpose of this presentation was to \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2020/08/28/elon-musk-demonstrates-neuralinks-tech-live-using-pigs-with-surgically-implanted-brain-monitoring-devices/#:~:text=TechCrunch-,Elon%20Musk%20demonstrates%20Neuralink's%20tech%20live%20using,surgically%2Dimplanted%20brain%20monitoring%20devices\u0026text=Elon%20Musk%20%2Dfounded%20Neuralink%20has,human%20brain%20and%20computing%20devices.?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecruit people\u003c/a\u003e to work at Neuralink (no neuroscience experience required). But that didn’t stop him from speculating on what the device could eventually achieve. Musk touched on everything from quadriplegics playing video games to opening a Tesla with your mind (he said there’s a 100% chance this happens). But the first uses are still \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnet.com/news/elon-musks-neuralink-its-like-a-fitbit-in-your-skull/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emedical in nature\u003c/a\u003e. \"I'm confident in the long term it'll be possible to restore somebody's full body motion,\" he said. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eSome analysts expected a human trial last night, but got pig demonstrations instead. People's brains are on the horizon, though—Musk announced that the FDA granted Neuralink \"breakthrough device\" designation, allowing the company to proceed on an accelerated timeline toward human collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe S\u0026P 500 had its best August since 1986, even while we had our worst August since DC's \u003cem\u003eSuicide Squad \u003c/em\u003ecame out. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat happened?\u003c/strong\u003e Big Tech happened. The de facto rulers of our world—Apple, Amazon, Facebook, Google, and Microsoft—account for almost a quarter of the S\u0026P 500. And their share prices have skyrocketed (especially Apple) this summer while the pandemic pushed our lives further into the digital realm. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLet this sink in: \u003c/strong\u003eThe market capitalization of U.S. tech stocks is \u003ca href=\"https://markets.businessinsider.com/news/stocks/us-tech-stocks-worth-more-european-stock-market-apple-microsoft-2020-8-1029545001?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enow greater\u003c/a\u003e than the value of the entire European stock market, according to Bank of America. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn Thursday, tech stocks hit $9.1 trillion in value; European stocks are worth $8.9 trillion. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLife does exist outside of tech, though, and “reopening” stocks like Delta and cruise lines also jumped this month. The Dow, not known for its tech prowess, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/08/27/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eerased its losses\u003c/a\u003e for the year yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThe economy was humming before the pandemic hit. Investors are betting that, with the Fed’s emergency measures and a vaccine in the works, we’ll eventually pick up where we left off. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe NBA playoffs \u003ca href=\"https://bleacherreport.com/articles/2906646-nba-postpones-friday-playoff-games-to-protest-racism-resuming-saturday?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill resume this afternoon\u003c/a\u003e after the players association and the league came to an agreement on issues concerning social justice and racial inequality yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory:\u003c/strong\u003e The Milwaukee Bucks decided not to play in their playoff game on Wednesday to protest the police shooting of Jacob Blake, a Black man, in Kenosha, WI. Many teams in other sports leagues \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/08/27/nba-players-strike-racial-justice?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejoined in\u003c/a\u003e, culminating in a historic week of athlete activism.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe nowstory: \u003c/strong\u003eIn a \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/TimBontemps/status/1299386010489499652?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1299386010489499652\u0026ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fbleacherreport.com%2Farticles%2F2906646-nba-postpones-friday-playoff-games-to-protest-racism-resuming-saturday\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejoint statement\u003c/a\u003e, the league and the players outlined three main initiatives:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEstablish a social justice coalition made up of players, coaches, and team officials \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWork with local governments to convert NBA arenas into safe voting locations for the 2020 election \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eReserve ad spots during each playoff game to promote voter participation and education\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eNBA players stopped the playoffs because they thought basketball was distracting the country from focusing on larger issues. With concrete reforms in hand, they're betting that resuming play will allow them to keep social justice issues top of mind as we head into the election.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThey don’t work without a freezer.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAs coronavirus vaccines enter late-stage clinical trials, logistics providers are \u003ca href=\"https://www.fiercepharma.com/manufacturing/pfizer-moderna-s-covid-19-shot-rollouts-could-be-ice-as-analysts-question-cold?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003escrambling\u003c/a\u003e to build supply chains that effectively transport those vaccines, once they’re ready, from manufacturing facilities to your doctor’s office.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut these vaccines are the worst kind of passenger—they \u003cem\u003eneed\u003c/em\u003e to be kept at very specific (and very cold) temperatures along their route, plus they’re always FaceTiming with someone. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne example: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe vaccine being developed by Pfizer and BioNTech needs to be stored at -94° Fahrenheit. At standard refrigerated temps it would go bad in 24 hours (Pfizer claims it’s two days).\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis demand for cold storage has led to the Great Freezer Building Project of 2020, with companies like UPS and Lufthansa spawning huge “\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/from-freezer-farms-to-jets-logistics-operators-prepare-for-a-covid-19-vaccine-11598639012?mod=hp_lista_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efreezer farms\u003c/a\u003e” near airports so they can store vaccines properly, the WSJ reports.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eEven before the pandemic, cold storage was booming along with the growing needs of the pharmaceutical industry. Now, it has a higher calling.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSince clubbing is out of the picture...maybe a game of style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1942: \u003c/strong\u003eAt the age of 11, Buffett purchases his first stock: three shares of Cities Service preferred. Trust us, it was a lot harder without Robinhood. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1956: \u003c/strong\u003eInstead of having a quarter-life crisis, the then-25-year-old forms a partnership with seven investors, putting down $100 of his own money.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1959: \u003c/strong\u003eBuffett pens his \u003ca href=\"https://rbcpa.com/warren-e-buffett/buffett-letters-1959-present/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst letter to partners\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1983: \u003c/strong\u003eA single share of Berkshire Hathaway stock passes $1,000.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1991: \u003c/strong\u003eWarren Buffett, then 60, meets Bill Gates, then 35. Much later, Buffett partners with the Gates Foundation to give away most of his wealth.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2006:\u003c/strong\u003e A single share of Berkshire Hathaway stock hits $100,000.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2018:\u003c/strong\u003e On cryptocurrency, Buffett \u003ca href=\"https://buffett.cnbc.com/buffett-timeline/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewarns\u003c/a\u003e, “Generally, I can say with almost certainty that they will come to a bad ending.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2020:\u003c/strong\u003e In his annual letter to shareholders, Buffett says, “Berkshire shareholders need not worry: Your company is 100% prepared for our departure.” Berkshire executives Ajit Jain and Greg Abel are \u003ca style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost likely\u003c/a\u003e to succeed him.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\"
